abstract.t: RadSec provides a means to secure the communication between a RADIUS client and server on the transport layer by using a TLS cipher-suite. This avoids the security weaknesses inherent in RADIUS' use of the MD5 algorithm. The Key Negotiation Protocol for RadSec enables a RADIUS client and RADIUS server to derive a key that can be used with a TLS PSK ciphersuite and applied with a RadSec connection.
